go_data.justification: HASF encodes a member of the Divergent protein kinases (Dipk) family, characterized by a cysteine-rich kinase-like domain.
Mammalian Dipk proteins, including HASF, are localized within the lumen of the secretory pathway.
A secreted form of Dipk2A, a human homolog of Aln and HASF, has been observed to bind to insulin receptors.
HASF is a novel ligand of the insulin-like growth factor 1 receptor.
A secreted form of Dipk2A, a human homolog of Aln and HASF, promotes cardiomyocyte proliferation by binding to insulin receptors.
